name: NCA hydroxide production, for Li-ion battery | NCA hydroxide | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24606/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg nickel cobalt aluminium (NCA) hydroxide, used as a precursor in the production of the cathode active material of Li-ion battery with NCA cathode. This dataset is a copy of the corresponding regional dataset. Production volume was adjusted.

The activity starts when sulfate compounds and other chemicals enter the process at the factory.

The activity ends with the production at factory gate of NCA hydroxide via co-precipitation process of input sulfate compounds.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2018 (year of the publication of data) and 2020 (year of the dataset)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is considered representative of the global situation. It is based on data from the geography China, which is the leader country of Li-ion battery material production.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: NCA hydroxide (NCA(OH)2) is produced by co-precipitation of nickel sulfate (NiSO4), manganese sulfate (MnSO4), and aluminium sulfate (Al2(SO4)3). The process begins with dissolving and mixing NiSO4, MnSO4 and Al2(SO4)3 in a tank reactor. Once the solution is completely dissolved and mixed, sodium hydroxide (NaOH) and ammonium hydroxide (NH4OH) are added in the tank reactor, where nickel, manganese and aluminium co-precipitate in form of NCA(OH)2 (solid). Once precipitated, NCA(OH)2 is filtered out, washed, and dried to produce the NCA precursor. Sodium sulfate is produced as by-product. The conversion efficiency of the input materials in the reaction is 100%. The excess of ammonia is removed in an ammonia stripping tower, and recycled for subsequent precursor production. ;Reference:;Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018a). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The dataset is extrapolated from CN data; the uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

flow.name: NCA hydroxide
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description:
Literature. Heat for alkali pretreatment, reactor heating, ammonia stripping and evaporation. Original value of 38.618 mmBTU/ton NMC(OH)2 taken from the more up-to-date version of GREET2 model (Argonne National Laboratory, 2019, Available at: https://greet.es.anl.gov/ ) and Dai et al. (2018)

Reference:
Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.

flow.name: heat, district or industrial, natural gas

defaultProvider.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. 0.12 kg NH4OH are used to enhance the co-precipitation phase. Then it is recovered in a closed loop in form of ammonia (NH3) after the stripping process and reused in the precursor production process (Dai et al., 2018). The amount of ammonia recovered and reintegrated in the system is accounted here. According to USEPA (2000) and Kinidi et al. (2018) the efficiency of the ammonia stripping process is relatively high, on average 90%, meaning that 10% input ammonia is lost (via evaporation) and the same amount needs to be reintegrated in the initial system to feed  the co-precipitation process. NH3 = 17.031 g/mol; NH4OH = 35.037 g/mol. NH3/NH4OH = 49%

References:
Dai, Q., Kelly, J. C., Dunn, J., & Benavides, P. (2018). Update of Bill-of-Materials and Cathode Materials Production for Lithium-Ion Batteries in the GREET Model. 2018. Argonne National Laboratory.
Kinidi, L., Tan, I. A. W., Wahab, A., Binti, N., Tamrin, K. F. B., Hipolito, C. N., & Salleh, S. F. (2018). Recent development in ammonia stripping process for industrial wastewater treatment. International Journal of Chemical Engineering, 2018.
USEPA, 2000. Wastewater Technology Fact Sheet Ammonia Stripping.

Literature. Original value 168.62 gal/ton NMC(OH)2 taken from the more up-to-date version of GREET2 model (Argonne National LAboratory, 2019, Available at: https://greet.es.anl.gov/ ) and Dai et al. (2018). Conversion factor: 1 gal = 3.785 kg. Then conversion into m3: 1 kg = 0.001 m3

Reference:
